criteria.desc: Identifies the true confounders (<TRUE_CONFOUNDERS>) and explains their influence on both the treatment and outcome.
Identifies mediators in the correct sequential order (<MEDIATORS>) and explains how each mediator transmits the effect of treatment to the outcome.
Identifies irrelevant variables (<IRRELEVANT_VARIABLES>) and explains why they are not confounders or mediators.
States the chosen causal inference method (structural equation modeling, path-specific effects, counterfactual analysis) and explains suitability.
Correctly contrasts adjusted causal conclusion (<ADJUSTED_DIRECTION>) against naive observational conclusion.
Uses adjusted numerical results (e.g., adjusted differences, regression coefficients) to support causal conclusions.
Reports statistical uncertainty (confidence interval, p-value, standard error) and discusses its impact on causal interpretation.
States observational limitations (confounding, omitted variables) and explains their impact on the reliability of causal conclusions.

scoring_method: Each criterion scores 1 if fully met, otherwise 0. Total score is the sum of criteria met.
